f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to tackle 3 problems. The first problem is that 1.2 billion people live off-grid, crypto investors have no access to energy-related crypto assets and energy consumers have a passive role and are not incentivized to produce green energy. Lighency wants to build a better Africa using the Cardano network. ADA holders will have the opportunity to participate in the mission to electrify Africa while earning attractive returns. Another advantage is that the end customers who usually do not have a bank account will have a digital identity on the Cardano network. This project will have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem by addressing a very large target group. People worldwide have the opportunity to participate in the improvement of Cardano. The main goals included in the proposal correspond to the outlined challenge setting. There are a few future risks included in the proposal. (macro risk, economic risks and cryptocurrency risk) It is good that the submitter has always included the extenuating circumstances with a clear explanation.
f6_assessments.q1: A few people have been included in the proposal along with their relevant experience. The linkedin of these people is not included. You can find their experiences and skills via their website (https://lightency.io) (+ linkedin). Their team members have enough experience to achieve all objectives. There is a very clear description of the budget. The submitter offers clear transparency to where the funding will go. It might be useful to include the working hours that the team members will need to get something done. The hourly wage could also be included. The budget seems sufficient to me to achieve the objectives. There will be a return in the future for financing to complete additional functions. A timetable has been included for the next 2 months and a half. The schedule consists of 8 parts to carry out all work. This timetable seems realistic to me to carry out all the work. The proposal provides a clear implementation plan with the steps needed to get it all done. The budget clearly states what is needed to implement the proposal. The detailed plan lists the technical aspects that must be carried out. This plan also includes a number of milestones. The challenges to be addressed are included in the proposal. It is good that these are divided into macro risk, economic risk and cryptocurrency risk. These have been clearly described by the submitter, together with the mitigating risks.
f6_assessments.q2:
An extensive road map with associated milestones has been included. The time frame for this proposal is 3 months and a half. The road map is divided into 8 parts. Several well-chosen milestones have been included for each part.
Some KPIs are included to track the progress of the project. I think there could be a little higher aim in terms of progress. I would go for at least 20 participants in the treasury funds and mint at least 3 energy certificates on Cardano. The submitter clearly describes the 3 issues that need to be addressed. The first problem is that 1.2 billion people live off-grid, crypto investors have no access to energy-related crypto assets and energy consumers have a passive role and are not incentivized to produce green energy. f6_assessments.q0: This is such an exciting and well-written proposal. I would love to see it up and running and creating a positive impact for Africa. Lightency is a technology company specialized in blockchain and renewable energy. Their goal with Powerchain is to create an energy data tokenization platform that allows P2P energy management and renewable-energy certification. This in turn would allow more Africans to have access to green and affordable energy while those who are able to produce some can sell their excess of electricity. These goals strongly align with the challenge settings as they would generate a local impact, attract more African users to Cardano and potentially form and foment local partnerships. Besides that, the solution is built in a scalable and bankable way from the beginning.
f6_assessments.q1: The team presented possesses a strong skillset with a lot of experience in renewable energy and blockchain technology. In their website they provide a bio for each one of the team members. The resources needed to implement the proposal are clearly identified and are satisfied by the five members listed. Additionally, the budget is divided by task required and for each the total amount is reasonable given the workload. Doing the math, we find the average hour rate is close to USD 50. Also, the deadlines estimated seem realistic and shouldn't be a burden to be completed in time. In their website they exhibit a timeline of the project as well. Moreover, the plan described is conductible and is explained in detail. Finally, there were some risks raised concerning the implementation. Volatility of their cryptocurrency could be an issue but they will allocate some of tokens to balance the liquidity pool and the treasury fund will be backed mostly by stablecoins. There are also economic and political risks intrinsic to the African continent. To mitigate that the team has picked up the countries with favorable regulation and where the situation is moderately stable. Also, they are incorporating a company in Mauritius as the country has agreements with most African countries.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has designed a roadmap with clear milestones. There are 8 phases and their duration varies from 4 days to 3 weeks depending on the task. Each of them has well-defined goals and are easy to assess if they have been successfully completed or not. The KPIs are implicitly defined but strongly align with the challenge settings and also translate well if the project has been successful or not. For example, number of Cardano holders participating in the treasury fund and number of energy certifications are KPIs that have been defined by the team. Another strong point of this plan are the SDGs aimed. For instance, SDG 7 and SDG 11, which are respectively, affordable and clean energy and sustainable cities and communities, are at the core of the proposal. However, they have not provided a public channel to update the community on the status of the project. Maybe they will do that on their website but that wasn’t mentioned in the proposal.

The proposer and his team has done a very wonderful job by presenting this proposal in this challenge. It is one of the innovative proposal I have come across in this challenge and I therefore say the proposal effectively addresses these challenges and has a great potential of bringing value to the cardano  ecosystem. The proposer and his team have done a vigorous job and their research proved that in most cases in Africa electricity is monopolized by government utilities agencies who are unable or failed to provide or to Electrify their citizenry. The proposal said that 2 out of 3 Africans have access to electricity which is woefully inadequate comparing with the Global expectation that by 2030 all countries electrification should reach the highest of all communities in the world. The same cannot be said here in the case of Africa, Africa is still lagging behind and so according to this proposer and his team they are channeling their resources time and energy to the provision of electricity through private bodies. A chunk of their innovative ways they intend to do it include, lightency which is to help build a better Africa using cardano network. Ada holders will be able to participate in the mission of electrifying Africa while earning attractive yields.
